title: VNC Send Special Keys, Windows Key
author: mathewalanfisher
body_snippet:
Feature Request to be able to send the Windows Key via the Send Special Keys menu option.

I'm using RDP and the menu is located when right clicking on the connected server tab. The menu item is called "Send Special Keys (RDP)".
At present the options are Ctrl-Alt-Del and Ctrl-Esc.
Is it possible to be able to add an extra item for sending the Windows Key?

This will be useful as the Server I'm using has a hidden taskbar. Its tricky to get to the taskbar in a RDP environment when hidden.
...

iterations.description: The Windows key is not correctly transmitted in VNC sessions; this can be fixed by intercepting the Windows key messages in `VncLockKeyFilter` and sending the appropriate X11 keysyms (XK_Super_L/R).

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The Windows key is not correctly transmitted in VNC sessions; this can be fixed by intercepting the Windows key messages in `VncLockKeyFilter` and sending the appropriate X11 keysyms (XK_Super_L/R).
Approach: Modify `VncLockKeyFilter` within `Connection.Protocol.VNC.cs` to intercept `VK_LWIN` and `VK_RWIN` messages and map them to X11 `XK_Super_L` and `XK_Super_R` keysyms respectively, sending them via `WriteKeyboardEvent`.
